news.headline: Illumina stocks dropped by nearly 5% and added to China's 'unreliable entities list' amidst trade tensions with US.
news.summary: Illumina Inc. (NASDAQ: ILMN) saw its shares drop by nearly 4% on Robinhood following an announcement by the Chinese Ministry of Commerce adding the company, along with PVH Corp. (NYSE: PVH), to the unreliable entities list amidst the ongoing trade tensions with the U.S. China stated that these firms have allegedly interfered with regular market operations, negatively impacting the lawful rights of Chinese businesses. The specific actions to be taken against the companies have not been revealed yet, but are anticipated to align with Chinese regulations. For more details, read the complete article on Benzinga.com.

news.headline: BNP Paribas CFO stated that Europe has an overabundance of banks. #finance #Europe
Bitcoin drops below $100K due to US-China tariffs; Analyst predicts ATH despite trade war tensions. Participants remain optimistic.
news.summary: After briefly reaching a value of over $100,000, Bitcoin has dropped as a new wave of trade tensions emerges. Despite this setback, investors remain optimistic and believe that the cryptocurrency market has weathered the worst of its challenges.

news.headline: Check Point Software maintains highest threat prevention rate for 3rd year in Miercom's report. Industry-leading security.
news.summary: Check Point Software has once again showcased the highest threat prevention rate in the industry for the third consecutive year, as per Miercom's Enterprise and Hybrid Mesh Firewall report. This marks a significant achievement for the company, solidifying its reputation as a leader in the cybersecurity sector. With an impressive performance across various metrics, including detection and prevention capabilities, Check Point Software has proven its commitment to providing top-notch security solutions. This recognition underscores the company's dedication to staying ahead of emerging threats and ensuring the safety of its customers.

news.headline: Evolito chosen to supply D250 electric motors for Flying Whales' LCA60T airship in Bicester, UK, boosting sustainable aviation.
news.summary: Evolito, a company based in Bicester, England, has been chosen to provide the D250 electric motors for Flying Whales' LCA60T airship. This selection aims to improve sustainable cargo aviation.

news.headline: AI's impact on modern romance explored with 60% of online daters suspecting their matches used AI for chatting.
news.summary: A recent study by Norton has revealed the significant impact of artificial intelligence on modern romance. Approximately 60% of online daters suspect that their matches utilize AI to engage in conversations with them. The study took place in Tempe, Arizona and Prague on February 4, 2025, indicating the growing trend of AI integration in dating platforms. This underscores the changing dynamics of human relationships in the digital age, with a majority of individuals believing that AI plays a role in their romantic interactions.

news.headline: Clarivate reports on medtech breakthroughs in pulsed field ablation market for atrial fibrillation treatment.
news.summary: A recently released e-book delves into the groundbreaking developments in pulsed field ablation for treating atrial fibrillation. Published on February 4, 2025, by Clarivate Plc (NYSE: CLVT), a prominent global provider of innovative intelligence, this e-book is available through BioWorld by Clarivate. The e-book aims to shed light on the advances in medtech, particularly focusing on atrial fibrillation treatment.

news.summary: Bayer Foundation and Impact Hub Network are now accepting applications for the 2025 Women Entrepreneurs Award in Leverkusen, Germany. The award will provide €25,000 and growth support to 15 winners to help them overcome scaling barriers for their innovative health solutions.

news.headline: Crisil Coalition Greenwich names J.P. Morgan as best global corporate bank and HSBC as top corporate FX bank for 2025.

The 2025 Best Bank and Share Leader award winners were announced by the organization in New York on February 4, 2025. This year, over 60 financial institutions were assessed for these prestigious accolades.

news.headline: Activist group's efforts impact FDA's rejection of MDMA therapy for PTSD, causing concerns for potential future psychedelic treatments.
news.summary: Researchers and experts are concerned following the FDA's rejection of a new treatment for PTSD, fearing it could impact other psychedelic drugs in development. The rejection has raised worries about the future of similar treatments, as the number of rejected treatments has reached a worrisome level. The uncertainty surrounding this decision has led to growing concerns within the research community about the potential setbacks in developing alternative therapies.

Hi-View Resources Inc. appoints Robert “Nick” Horsley as CEO, with 20 years experience in various industries.
news.summary: In Vancouver, British Columbia, on February 4, 2025, Hi-View Resources Inc. (referred to as ‘Hi-View' or the ‘Company’) has named Mr. Robert “Nick” Horsley as the new CEO. With a wealth of over 20 years in public markets, Mr. Horsley brings expertise in finance, investor relations, marketing, management, and mergers & acquisitions. He has previously held roles as director and consultant for numerous public and private enterprises across diverse sectors such as mineral exploration, telecom, CPG, Esports, and technology. The Company is listed on the Canadian Stock Exchange (CSE: HVW), OTC Markets (OTCQB: HVWRF), and the Frankfurt Stock Exchange (FSE: B63).

news.headline: Check Point launches 2 AI management bundles for Infinity Platform, enhancing security in hybrid environments.

This advancement aims to enhance security in hybrid environments by providing more effective protection. These new bundles offer advanced AI capabilities that empower organizations to combat cybersecurity threats efficiently. With this update, Check Point continues to position itself as a leader in the cybersecurity industry by delivering innovative solutions to safeguard digital assets.

news.headline: AudioCodes' Q4 revenues down 3.2% YoY to $61.6M, full-year 2024 revenues decreased by 0.9% to $242.2M. declares 18 cents/share dividend.

Additionally, the full year of 2024 experienced a decrease in revenues by 0.9%, totaling $242.2 million. On a positive note, quarterly service revenues saw a significant increase of 10.9% year-over-year to an undisclosed amount.

news.headline: Lleida.net grows turnover by 16%, reaching 2.56 million euros in 2024. Achieved an EBITDA profit of 3.26 million, a 3792% YoY growth. Profit before tax increased by 131% to over 3.56 million euros. Company reduces long-term debt by 18%, totaling 7.41 million euros. Personnel costs and external services decreased by 19% and 25% respectively, saving around 2 million euros. CEO sees success in restructuring, with growth in all business lines.
news.summary: Listed Spanish company Lleida.net reported a significant increase in sales in 2024, reaching 2.56 million euros, representing a 16% growth compared to the previous year. The company's turnover totaled 19.05 million euros, showing a 2.56 million euro improvement from 2023. Lleida.net recorded an EBITDA of 3.26 million euros, a substantial increase from 84,000 euros in 2023, marking a 3792% year-over-year growth. The profit before tax surged by 131% to over 3.56 million euros in 2024. The company saw a profit of 840,000 euros this year, rebounding from a loss of 2.72 million in 2023. The CEO credited the success to the company's efforts and restructuring. Sales across all business lines, notably Registered Electronic Notification and ICX Wholesale, experienced double-digit growth. The company also managed to reduce long-term debt by 18%, which amounted to 2.4 million euros less than in 2023. Personnel cost and external services were slashed by 19% and 25%, respectively, leading to approximately two million euros in savings.

Signify launches EUR 150 million share repurchase program, covering 7 million shares or 5.5% of total shares, ending in 2025.
news.summary: Signify, a leading lighting company, has initiated a share repurchase program to buy back EUR 150 million of its own shares, with EUR 30 million allocated for its employee share plans. The program, aimed at buying back approximately 7 million shares or 5.5% of the company's share capital at the current price, will commence on February 4, 2025, and is expected to conclude by the end of the year. The repurchase activities will adhere to legal regulations and the authority granted by the Annual General Meeting of Shareholders in May 2024. Progress updates will be provided on Signify's website and through press releases.

news.headline: Tallink Grupp transported 299,991 passengers in January 2025, down by 9.1% from Jan 2024. Cargo units -33.6%, 18,986 units. Passenger vehicles -13.2%, 43,622 units.
news.summary: In January 2025, AS Tallink Grupp ferried a total of 299,991 passengers, showing a 9.1% drop from the figures in January 2024. The transported cargo units also declined by 33.6% to 18,986 units, while the number of passenger vehicles decreased by 13.2% to 43,622 units compared to the previous year.

news.headline: Pepto-Bismol returns to UK markets, now available in supermarkets, online, and pharmacies to tackle multiple digestive symptoms.
news.summary: In London, a popular solution for digestive discomfort, Pepto-Bismol Oral Suspension, has made a return to the UK market. This product is now conveniently stocked in supermarkets, online, and in pharmacies across the country. It provides relief for individuals experiencing various symptoms in a single episode of digestive issues. The widespread availability of Pepto-Bismol aims to make it easier for consumers to address their tummy troubles effectively.
